frontmatter.pageTitle: Tarangire National Park: Tanzania's Hidden Safari Gem

pageProps.content:
Experience

Tarangire National Park, one of Tanzania's best-kept secrets, offers a unique safari experience.
While many travelers flock to Tanzania's famous destinations like the Serengeti &amp Ngorongoro Crater, Tarangire National Park remains a hidden gem. This pristine wilderness is renowned for its tree-climbing lions, large elephant herds, impressive predator sightings, &amp exceptional birdwatching. Unique species like the long-necked gerenuk &amp rare fringed-eared oryx call this park home.
During the dry season, Tarangire comes alive with wildlife, drawing migratory animals like wildebeest, zebra, common eland, hartebeest, gazelle, buffalo, &amp numerous elephant herds to the Tarangire River.

Activities

Tarangire National Park offers a wealth of activities, ensuring an exciting stay. Choose from day &amp night game drives, guided walks, thrilling balloon safaris, immersive fly-camping experiences, cultural village visits, picturesque sundowner excursions, enchanting bush dinners, &amp day trips to nearby Lake Manyara or Ngorongoro Crater.

When to travel

For the best wildlife viewing, visit during the dry season from late June to October when the Tarangire River attracts a profusion of wildlife. During November &amp December, the short rains disperse many animals, but January &amp February provide dry conditions. March to May ushers in the wet season, with heavy rains rendering much of the park inaccessible &amp most camps closed.

subfolders.title: Chem Chem Lodge
subfolders.description: With an ideal location in a private concession between Tarangire & Lake Manyara National Parks, Chem Chem Lodge boasts jaw-dropping views over the lake itself. The Chem Chem concession is known for its large herds of buffaloes & elephants, so guests can enjoy thrilling wildlife encounters mixed with utter relaxation.  The pace here echoes the Swahili saying, ‘Pole, pole’, which means ‘Slowly, slowly!’  No need to hurry here.

subfolders.title: Kuro Tarangire Camp
subfolders.description: Kuro Tarangire is named after the life-giving Tarangire River & discreetly tucked into a grove of secluded riverine bush in its namesake’s National Park. It is not uncommon for elephants to pass right through the camp on their way to the Sllale Swamp to drink & play.  In fact, Tarangire is renowned for its massive herds of elephants & buffaloes that often attract hungry predators on the prowl for food.

subfolders.title: Lemala Mpingo Ridge
subfolders.description: Perched on top of a cliff with jaw-dropping views over the Tarangire River, lies the beautiful Lemala Mpingo Ridge. In dry season – between June & October, this water source becomes a drawcard to Tarangire National Park’s large herds of buffalo, elephant & giraffe – a wonderful sight to behold.

subfolders.title: Little Oliver's Camp
subfolders.description: Little Oliver’s Camp is situated in the secluded south-eastern sector of Tarangire National Park, just downstream from its famous sister, Oliver’s Camp. Truly authentic, the camp is set in a remote, uncrowded sector of the park, offering guests that sought-after off-the-beaten-track safari experience.

subfolders.title: Nimali Tarangire
subfolders.description: Nimali Tarangire is set on the banks of a seasonal river in a private reserve adjoining Tarangire National Park in Tanzania. Discerning travellers seeking a private & unspoilt safari experience will fall in love with Nimali Tarangire - a luxury safari haven surrounded by an untouched landscape.

subfolders.title: Oliver's Camp
subfolders.description: Oliver’s Camp is situated in the secluded south-eastern sector of Tarangire National Park & offers an off-the-beaten-track safari experience with superior service & excellent guiding. Truly authentic, the camp is set in a remote, uncrowded sector of Tarangire:  home to the renowned tree-climbing lions, large herds of elephants & the unusual long-necked gerenuk.

subfolders.title: Sanctuary Swala Camp
subfolders.description: The secluded & luxurious Sanctuary Swala Camp is situated under a canopy of large acacia trees at the edge of the Gurusi wetlands in Tarangire National Park. With sweeping views of the rolling savannah beyond, Swala is the only camp in this part of Tarangire & therefore offers an exclusive safari to discerning travellers who seek the best in wilderness luxury.

subfolders.title: Tarangire Ndovu Camp
subfolders.description: Tarangire Ndovu Camp is situated in the heart of Tarangire National Park – Tanzania’s lesser-visited but more intriguing park on the northern safari circuit. The park is famed for its rare tree-climbing lions as well as large herds of elephants & buffaloes.  The odd-looking long-necked gerenuk can also be seen here.

subfolders.title: Tarangire River Camp
subfolders.description: The classic Tarangire River Camp boasts an ideal setting overlooking the Tarangire River in a 25,000-hectare private concession adjacent to Tarangire National Park. With beautiful views, spacious tents & excellent wildlife viewing – the camp is a wonderful choice for families, friends or couples looking for an intriguing safari experience.

subfolders.title: Tarangire Treetops
subfolders.description: Tarangire Treetops fulfils our ultimate childhood dream!  Set on a hill with sweeping views to Lake Manyara & the Rift Valley wall, these luxurious treehouses remind us of our inner child. Situated directly on the path of an annual migration, the camp sits alone in a community wildlife area bordering Tanzania’s Tarangire National Park.
